      • createTable

        public static void createTable(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                               java.lang.Class<?> tableClass)
        Creates the table from the object. The DB must be passed in from the SQLiteOpenHelper otherwise an illegal state exception will occur

      • dropTable

        public static void dropTable(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                             java.lang.Class<?> tableClass)
        Drops the table created from the table object. The DB must be passed in from the SQLiteOpenHelper otherwise an illegal state exception will occur

        Insert the object into the table

      • update

        public void update(java.lang.Object tableObject)
        Updates an Object. This object MUST have it's id field populated with the id of the row you are trying to update.
        Parameters:
        tableObject - The object that will update a row in the table

      • delete

        public void delete(java.lang.Object tableObject)
        Deletes the object from the table in which it resides. This does the look up based off of the ID of the object. Passing in an object with out and ID will not delete other rows.
        Parameters:
        tableObject - table object with ID field populated.

      • delete

        public void delete(java.lang.Class<?> tableClass,
                   long id)
        Deletes a row in the table with the corresponding ID.
        Parameters:
        tableClass - The class which was used to generate the table that you want to delete the corresponding row out of.
        id - the id of the row you want to match

      • map

        public <T extends java.util.List<M>,M> T map(java.lang.Class<? extends M> tableClass,
                                             android.database.Cursor cursor)
        Maps data from the cursor to it's corresponding model object.
        Parameters:
        tableClass - Class the data from the cursor should be mapped to. This class must have the
        cursor - Cursor of data pulled from the tableClass's generated table.
        Returns:
        List of tableClass objects mapped from the cursor.
        See Also:
        annotation on it

      • singleMap

        public <T> T singleMap(java.lang.Class<? extends T> tableClass,
                       android.database.Cursor cursor)
        Map the cursor at it's current position to a single value. This does not close the cursor or move the cursor ahead.
        Parameters:
        tableClass - The class to map to.
        cursor - The cursor to get the values from it's current position.
        Returns:
        The mapped value.
